content.description: Chipped footholds and larger chipped handholds near solid positive flakes. This route was reportedly previously soloed by locals.
content.location: Begin on the north side of light-colored ten foot high block, near the center of the east face.

content.description:
The opening few moves are thin.  A little higher was a strech move to gain the only bolt at about 20 feet up. Climb easy ledges to the crack another 20 feet up and sink some gear. Bring a sling and you can equalize several cams. Climb easy knobs and ledges above, merging with "Ankles Away", sharing the same anchor. (Note: This is how I climbed the route. I didn't see anchors for this route specifically, though the Croft/Lewis book shows anchors.)

A good spicy challenge in the otherwise heavily bolted hills.  Take great care not to break holds to avoid long falls.
content.protection: 1 bolt + cam(s) at the high horizontal crack. I brought a .75, 1 and 2 C4 and they all fit in the crack.

climbs.name: Leonosphere
climbs.fa: Brant Allen, Raleigh Collins, Keith Brueckner

content.location:
The left-most line of bolts on Hoodgie Wall.  See

photo

content.description:
Start through the obvious round hueco  about eight feet left from the left edge of the north face. Climb up over the hueco, then diagonal right to the ridge  between the east face and north face. Continue climbing up the ridge curving slightly right to a chain anchor.

warning: Since this route is new as of 2016, expect loose rock and breaking holds. The belayer or other persons should not stand anywhere near underneath the route.
content.protection: 7  bolts up to a chain anchor.
content.location: By the ridge which forms the boundary between the East face and main North face of the Hoodgie.

content.description:
Excellent, steep face climbing at a moderate grade.  NOT a sport route--only 4 bolts protect the route.

Contributor's note: I have NOT led this route.  It is possible to traverse right from the anchor atop Ankles Away (easy 5th class) in order to set up a top-rope.  Don't miss this high quality route!
content.location:
The right side of Hoodgie Wall (look for a bolt about 25 feet up).  See

photo

content.description:
Wide crack that is a little loose in spots.  Still worth the effort.

From the top of the crack, step right and climb a face past the last 2 bolts of Ankles Away to a bolted anchor.
content.protection: Gear to 4", one bolt, bolted top anchor (shared with Ankles Away)
content.location:
The obvious wide crack on the left side of Hoodgie Wall (between Holy Shiite, Muslim & Ankles Away).  See

photo

content.description: Start by laybacking to the left a short flake.This opening move is the physical crux. From there climb up to chain+ring top anchor shared with the sport route to the left. To enjoy the easier fun stuff above, without first struggling through the difficult start, one can access the route by aid or by climbing Leonosphere, then  lowering down into this route to just above the layback flake.
content.protection: Pro to 3" - could use bolts above as it is a nice line. Not sure if it's been solo'd by the east side folks already, but if not, might be a nice addition. No objection from me.  Squeezy at the bottom. Better to start in the left crack maybe with more gear options or make that a separate line altogether?
content.location: Left side of Hoodgie Wall. Descend from two-bolts-with-chain anchor for the bolted sport route to left of this one.

climbs.name: Ankles Away
climbs.fa: Jeff Neer, Diane Escobar, Raleigh Collins

content.description: High quality face climbing that is well protected.
content.location:
Located on the left-hand side of the main face of Hoodgie (and just right of the obvious wide crack, Holy Shiite, Muslim!)  See

photo
